titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Intended Smoking Quit Date - Description

div.p: Intended Smoking Quit Date is a PLANNED ACTIVITY DATE TIME.
Intended Smoking Quit Date is the date set by a PERSON on which they intend to stop smoking.
For PERSONS using bupropion, it is recommended that an Intended Smoking Quit Date is set within the first 2 weeks of therapy, usually in the second week, e.g. day 8.

For PERSONS using varenicline, current license specification and preliminary guidance indicates that an Intended Smoking Quit Date should fall on the 8th day after commencement of dosing with varenicline.
